ARABIC: وَفِى عَادٍ إِذْ أَرْسَلْنَا عَلَيْهِمُ ٱلرِّيحَ ٱلْعَقِيمَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: And also in 'Ad when We unleashed against them the barren wind,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: In 'Ad (also is a sign), when We sent a blasting wind against them,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: There is also a Sign for you in (the story of) Ad, when We let loose upon them an ominous wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: There is also evidence of the Truth in the story of Ad whom We struck with a violent wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And in the tribe of A’ad, when we sent a dry windstorm upon them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And in `Ad when We sent against them the barren wind;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And in Ad: When We sent upon them the destructive wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And also in Ad, when We loosed against them the withering wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And in (the tribe of) A'ad (there is a portent) when we sent the fatal wind against them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: There is another sign in the [tribe of] 'Ad, when We sent against them a life-destroying wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And in `A-ad also was a lesson, when We sent against them the barren wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: And in ‘Ad when We unleashed upon them a barren wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And in the 'Ad (people) (was another Sign): Behold, We sent against them the devastating Wind:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And in 'Ad (there is also a sign) when We sent against them the barren wind;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: And in Aad. We let loose on them a withering wind
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And in Aad. We unleashed against them the devastating wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And in 'Aad [was a sign], when We sent against them the barren wind.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [51:41] And [also] in, the destruction of, ‘Ād, was a sign, when We unleashed against them a barren wind, [a wind] which brings nothing of good, for it does not bear any rain and does not pollinate any trees; this [wind] was the west wind (al-dabūr).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And in (the tribe of) 'Aad) the people of Hud ((there is a portent) when We sent) We set on them (the fatal wind against them) the severe wind in which there was no comfort for them, this is the west wind.
